statement.tex: %text Find the scalar components of the vector $\ora{AB}$ with initial point $A(2,1)$ and terminal point $B(-5,7)$. %

step.context: %text Is the following expression for $\ora{AB}$ correct if $A(2,1)$ and $B(-5,7)$, are the initial and terminal points of the vector? %
step.reason: %text If $(x_1, y_1)$ and $(x_2,y_2)$ are the initial and final points of a vector, the expression for the vector is given by $\vector{(x_2-x_1)}{(y_2-y_1)}{}$. % \therefore \ora{AB}=\vector{(-5-2)}{(7-6)}{}=\vector{-7}{6}{}

step.context: %text Are the scalar ($x$ and $y$) components of $\ora{AB}=\vector{7}{-6}{}$ correct as shown below? %
step.reason: %text x and y (scalar) components of a vector are the projections of the vector along the x and y axis. Since $\hat i$ and $\hat j$ are the unit vectors along the x and y axis respectively, the projection is given by the coefficients of $\hat i$ and $\hat j$. % \begin{align} &\qquad\ora{AB}=\vector{7}{-6}{} \\ &\qquad\text{x-component}=7 \\ &\qquad\text{y-component}=-6 \end{align}
